title: Can my screen be replaced under warranty?
content:
Screen burn-in became apparent several months ago, it has progressively gotten worse - making the sections of the screen normally used by the on-screen buttons and status bar nearly useless for watching videos and it can be quite distracting for reading text. 

A more pressing issue, however, is that the phone screen is not nearly as bright as it used to be. I first noticed this when a friend and I were comparing his new Pixel 2 XL to my 18 month old Pixel 2 XL, my screen at 100% brightness was matching his at less than 75% brightness. This issue has gotten worse as in the past weeks it has become quite hard to see the phone outside - even under conditions where I was able to view fine in the past. 

I have spent the past hour going through the Google Pixel Phone Help pages looking for a way to file a claim, speak to a representative, or even check my specific phone's current warranty status, however, this is the closest I have come to being able to do any of that. 

So, for starters, I need to know if this is covered in the 2-year warranty of the Pixel 2 XL, and how I go about filing a warranty claim for it. 

Thank you for your time and support.
